de: Dieser 1h15-stündige Spaziergang lädt dazu ein, die Vergangenheit des Dorfes Auriol zu entdecken, indem man den alten Kanälen und den Ufern des Huveaune folgt.
en: This 1h15 walk invites you to discover the past of the village of Auriol by following the old canals and the banks of the Huveaune.
it: Questa passeggiata di 1h15 invita a scoprire il passato del villaggio di Auriol seguendo gli antichi canali e le rive dell'Huveaune.
fr: Cette balade d'1h15 invite à découvrir le passé du village d'Auriol en suivant les anciens canaux et les rives de l'Huveaune.
es: Este paseo de 1h15 le invita a descubrir el pasado del pueblo de Auriol siguiendo los antiguos canales y las orillas del Huveaune.
nl: Deze wandeling van 1u15 nodigt u uit om het verleden van het dorp Auriol te ontdekken door de oude kanalen en de oevers van de Huveaune te volgen.

en:
N°1 : From the town hall, go towards the Cours du 4 septembre, and cross it. At the level of the bridge go along the Huveaune on the right. Further on the left you have the old sawmill Plumier.

N°2: The Plumier sawmill today houses the library, the tourist office, the police station and the "restos du cœur". The building has two chimneys. The one at the end was used for a steam engine that operated the swift when the water level was too low to operate the mill.
After the Plumier, follow the direction of the street by turning left, and take a left on the rue Martinet. Following the street, you have the pavement on the left, under which is the canal called "Béal du Martinet" which fed the mill operating the martinet of Plumier, hence the name of the canal and therefore of the street. This canal was previously open to the air.
Continue straight on the rue des écoles. When you reach the courtyard of Verdun, turn left. Walk on the right sidewalk. You are still following the canal under your feet.

N°3 As you approach the town hall, turn to the right on avenue Marceau Julien. The canal runs under the left pavement; follow it. After 100 meters on your left, you will see old sawmills, a silk spinning mill and a carrot washing plant which use the canal water.
Go straight ahead on the left to cross the boulevard. And follow the canal on the left which is now visible.

N°4: On your left a green space, and a little further is the reservoir which feeds the canal. It is at this level that you will find the confluence between the Vede which arrives from the right, and the Huveaune which arrives from the left.
Continue straight on along the Vede, and take the footbridge that crosses it. 100 metres further on, follow the path on the left, then the small path crossing the green space. And go along the Huveaune on the left. Cross a small ditch and climb a small slope opposite. Continue to walk along the river

N°5: On your right the college UBELKA. UBELKA is the Celto-Ligurian name of the Huveaune, known as the devastating, because of its violent autumn floods. Cross the bridge over the river. On the right side you can see a small reservoir. 150 metres further up the road, you can see on the left the château St Pierre which belongs to the commune and is reserved for weddings.
On the right you have the Foulon, an old oil mill, and was also a sharpening workshop and a sawmill. The building has a statuette of Saint Peter.
Turn left onto the path of Saint Pierre.

N°6: On your right, an old cotton mill which was later a chair factory. Under the pavement on the right, there is another canal which has its source near Saint Zacharie

N°7 : At the intersection, on the right, when you turn around you will see an oratory with statues of the three Wise Men. On the left of the road, there is an old butcher shop. Approach the canal, which runs in the open air to the left of the road. You can see an old paddle wheel that used to drive the mill.
Continue to follow the path of Saint Pierre. Take the pavement on the right where the canal runs underneath. At one point a wall rises to the right of the pavement; it contains the canal. Further on it passes again on the left hand side and is visible.

N°8: Before the place Charles Adrien, you have on the right the old Ravel cotton mill, which was later a factory of sailcloth for ships. A little further on the right you have a shelter with benches which is an old wash house, with ceramic plates under the roof from the Plumier factory. Continue on Rue des Gorgues. 100 metres further on the left you will see the canal waterfall which is 11 metres deep. It feeds the old flour mill. Then go down the stairs to the church square.
N°9: On your left you pass the neo-Romanesque church of the parish of Auriol dating from the 19th century. On the right you have the big orc coloured facade of the flour mill. Turn right into the rue de la paroisse.

N°10 : At the end of the street you can see the clock tower dating from 1564. Before this tower, turn left into rue Augustine Dupuy. By turning around on your right, you have the old town hall which dates from the 17th century. Its fountain dates from 1927. Go down the street Augustine Dupuy. At the crossroads, turn left onto the D560. 50 metres further on, turn right onto the footbridge over the Huveaune. From the footbridge you have a panoramic view of the river and its quays. On the right bank upstream, you can see a yellow building with a fresco; it is an old oil mill. At the end of the footbridge you are back on the Cours du 4 septembre. The town hall, the starting point, is on the left.

de:
Die kleine Wasserindustrie geht auf das 16. Jahrhundert zurück und baute auf der Nutzung der mechanischen Kraft des Wassers auf. Um das Wasser des Huveaune besser nutzen zu können, wurden kleine Dämme (oder "resclaves") errichtet, die künstliche Wasserläufe mit direktem Zugang zum Fluss schufen. Sie wurden "béals" genannt und dienten dem Betrieb der ersten Mühlen in industriellen und handwerklichen Tätigkeiten wie Sägewerken, Mehl-, Öl-, Textil- und Metallverarbeitung. Hammerwerke waren am Beal selbst angebracht, um seinen Durchfluss zu kontrollieren oder um eine Umleitung zu einer Mühle, einem Reservoir usw. zu speisen.
iver Kurs am 4. September
en:
The small hydraulic industry dates back to the 16th century and was built around the use of the mechanical power of water. In order to make better use of the waters of the Huveaune, small dams (or "resclaves") were built, allowing the creation of artificial waterways with a direct connection to the river. Called "beals", they were used for the operation of the first mills in industrial and craft activities such as sawmills, flour, oil, textiles and metalworking. Hammerheads were placed on the béal itself to control its flow or to feed a diversion to a mill, a reservoir...
iver Course of September 4.
it:
La piccola industria idraulica risale al XVI secolo ed è stata costruita intorno all'uso della forza meccanica dell'acqua. Per sfruttare meglio le acque dell'Huveaune, sono state costruite piccole dighe (o "resclaves") che hanno permesso di creare corsi d'acqua artificiali con un collegamento diretto al fiume. Chiamati "beali", venivano utilizzati per far funzionare i primi mulini in attività industriali e artigianali come segherie, farina, olio, tessuti e lavorazione dei metalli. Le teste di martello venivano posizionate sul béal stesso per controllarne il flusso o per alimentare una deviazione verso un mulino, un serbatoio, ecc.
corso del 4 settembre.
fr:
La petite industrie hydraulique remonte au xvie siècle et s'est bâtie autour de l'usage de la force mécanique de l'eau. Afin de mieux utiliser les eaux de l'Huveaune, de petits barrages (ou " resclaves ") étaient bâtis, permettant la création de cours d'eau artificiels avec prise directe sur la rivière. Appelés " béals ", ils servirent au fonctionnement des premiers moulins dans les activités industrielles et artisanales telles que la scierie, la farine, l'huile, le textile, le travail des métaux. Des martelières étaient disposées sur le béal lui-même pour contrôler son débit ou pour alimenter une dérivation vers un moulin, un réservoir...
iver Cours du 4 septembre.
es:
La pequeña industria hidráulica se remonta al siglo XVI y se construyó en torno al uso de la fuerza mecánica del agua. Para aprovechar mejor las aguas del Huveaune, se construyeron pequeñas presas (o "resclaves") que permitieron crear vías de agua artificiales con conexión directa al río. Llamados "beals", sirvieron para hacer funcionar los primeros molinos en actividades industriales y artesanales como aserraderos, harineras, aceiteras, textiles y metalúrgicas. Las cabezas de martillo se colocaban en el propio béal para controlar su caudal o para alimentar una derivación a un molino, un embalse, etc.
curso de inglés del 4 de septiembre.
nl:
De kleine hydraulische industrie dateert uit de 16e eeuw en is opgebouwd rond het gebruik van de mechanische kracht van water. Om het water van de Huveaune beter te benutten werden kleine dammen (of "resclaves") gebouwd, waardoor kunstmatige waterwegen met een directe verbinding met de rivier konden worden aangelegd. Ze werden "beals" genoemd en werden gebruikt om de eerste molens in industriële en ambachtelijke activiteiten zoals zaagmolens, meel, olie, textiel en metaalbewerking te bedienen. Hamers werden op het béal zelf geplaatst om het debiet ervan te regelen of om een omleiding naar een molen, een reservoir, enz. te voeden.
iver Course van 4 september.
